Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

DD_Attribute_Full.name: start_primary_key
DD_Attribute_Full.definition: In a TABLE object, the START_PRIMARY_KEY element indicates the beginning of the range of values for the PRIMARY_KEY column in the table. If PRIMARY_KEY consists of multiple column names, then START_PRIMARY_KEY is a sequence of values, one for each column. The data type of this keyword is determined by the data type of the column of interest.

Terminological_Entry.name: start_primary_key
Terminological_Entry.definition: In a TABLE object, the START_PRIMARY_KEY element indicates the beginning of the range of values for the PRIMARY_KEY column in the table. If PRIMARY_KEY consists of multiple column names, then START_PRIMARY_KEY is a sequence of values, one for each column. The data type of this keyword is determined by the data type of the column of interest.

DD_Value_Domain_Full.formation_rule: Values for this element are selected from the valid values in the data column named as the primary key for the table. If the table has more tha one primary key as identified by the PRIMARY_KEY element, then both STAR and STOP_PRIMARY_KEY consist of a sequence of values, one value from eac of the primary key columns, in the order that they are listed in the PRIMARY_KEY element.
